intro: Lellingeria calolepis, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Lellingeria calolepis thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and mild, anise-like fragrance.
